fullName.value: Amyloid beta precursor protein-binding protein 1, 59 kDa

texts.value: Regulatory subunit of the dimeric UBA3-NAE1 E1 enzyme. E1 activates NEDD8 by first adenylating its C-terminal glycine residue with ATP, thereafter linking this residue to the side chain of the catalytic cysteine, yielding a NEDD8-UBA3 thioester and free AMP. E1 finally transfers NEDD8 to the catalytic cysteine of UBE2M. Necessary for cell cycle progression through the S-M checkpoint. Overexpression of NAE1 causes apoptosis through deregulation of NEDD8 conjugation. The covalent attachment of NEDD8 to target proteins is known as 'neddylation' and the process is involved in the regulation of cell growth, viability and development
Binding of TP53BP2 to the regulatory subunit NAE1 decreases neddylation activity
Heterodimer of UBA3 and NAE1. The complex binds NEDD8 and UBE2M. Binds APP and TP53BP2
Colocalizes with APP in lipid rafts
Ubiquitous in fetal tissues. Expressed throughout the adult brain
Ubiquitinated by TRIP12, leading to its degradation by the proteasome

disease.diseaseId: Neurodevelopmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and ischiopubic hypoplasia
disease.description: An autosomal recessive disorder characterized by moderate to severe global developmental delay, facial dysmorphism, and ischiopubic synchondrosis hypoplasia. Affected individuals show infection-triggered lymphopenia, and loss of developmental milestones associated with epileptic spasms. Diminished white matter volume, enlarged ventricles, and thin corpus callosum are visible on brain imaging.

texts.value: The disease may be caused by variants affecting the gene represented in this entry
NAE1 and UBA3 correspond to the N-terminal and the C-terminal part of yeast UBA3. In yeast the two subunits form a single polypeptide chain
Belongs to the ubiquitin-activating E1 family. ULA1 subfamily

features.description: in NEDFIH; uncertain significance; decreased protein abundance in homozygous patient cells; patient cells show a decreased amount of neddylated proteins; dbSNP:rs752555475
Impairs the formation of the NEDD8-UBA3 thioester.

citation.title: APP-BP1, a novel protein that binds to the carboxyl-terminal region of the amyloid precursor protein.
Identification of a new human protooncogene.
Complete sequencing and characterization of 21,243 full-length human cDNAs.
Genome duplications and other features in 12 Mb of DNA sequence from human chromosome 16p and 16q.
Towards a catalog of human genes and proteins: sequencing and analysis of 500 novel complete protein coding human cDNAs.
The sequence and analysis of duplication-rich human chromosome 16.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Identification of the activating and conjugating enzymes of the NEDD8 conjugation pathway.
The amyloid precursor protein-binding protein APP-BP1 drives the cell cycle through the S-M checkpoint and causes apoptosis in neurons.
Conservation in the mechanism of Nedd8 activation by the human AppBp1-Uba3 heterodimer.
APP-BP1 mediates APP-induced apoptosis and DNA synthesis and is increased in Alzheimer's disease brain.
ASPP2 inhibits APP-BP1-mediated NEDD8 conjugation to cullin-1 and decreases APP-BP1-induced cell proliferation and neuronal apoptosis.
TRIP12 functions as an E3 ubiquitin ligase of APP-BP1.
Lysine acetylation targets protein complexes and co-regulates major cellular functions.
